Record.ClassificationPath: Behavior and Behavior Mechanisms/Behavior/Impulsive Behavior/Compulsive Behavior
Record.Description: The behavior of performing an act persistently and repetitively without it leading to reward or pleasure. The act is usually a small, circumscribed behavior, almost ritualistic, yet not pathologically disturbing. Examples of compulsive behavior include twirling of hair, checking something constantly, not wanting pennies in change, straightening tilted pictures, etc.
